World.headline: Goa nightclub tragedy: Fire started by electric crackers; bodies found on top of each other
World.summary: A devastating fire at an 'Island' nightclub in Goa, reportedly sparked by electric crackers, led to the deaths of 23-25 people, including tourists and staff, with bodies found piled up. The tragedy exposed severe safety violations, including blocked exits and lack of fire clearance, making firefighting difficult and turning a family vacation into grief for many.
key_points: Fire caused by electric crackers at an 'Island' nightclub in Arpora, Goa.
At least 23-25 fatalities, with bodies found on top of each other due to blocked exits.
The club lacked fire clearance and violated building norms, impeding rescue efforts.
Many victims were tourists, highlighting public safety concerns in similar venues.
